thread.title: Barcelona, Madrid start Copa del Rey against 3rd-tier teams
thread.title_full: Barcelona, Madrid start Copa del Rey against 3rd-tier teams

author: wtopstaff
title: Barcelona, Madrid start Copa del Rey against 3rd-tier teams
text:
Home » News » Sports » Barcelona, Madrid start Copa… Barcelona, Madrid start Copa del Rey against 3rd-tier teams By The Associated Press October 16, 2015 6:46 am Real Madrid's striker Cristiano Ronaldo poses with the Golden Boot award for scoring the most goals in Europe's domestic leagues last season during a ceremony in Madrid, Spain Tuesday Oct. 13, 2015. This is the fourth Golden Boot award Ronaldo has won during his career and his third since joining Real Madrid, where he scored 48 goals during the last La Liga season. (AP Photo/Francisco Seco) 
MADRID (AP) — Defending champion Barcelona and Real Madrid will start their Copa del Rey campaigns against third-tier clubs. 
Barcelona will travel to western Spain to play the first leg against Villanovense on Oct. 28 to make room in the calendar to play at the Club World Cup. Madrid, which will face Cadiz, and the rest of the teams will play their first legs during the first week of December. 
Atletico Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla were also paired with third-tier teams. 
This round is the first to include the 20 first-division teams. It will include four direct matchups between topflight clubs: Real Betis vs. Sporting Gijon; Levante vs. Espanyol; Las Palmas vs. Real Sociedad; and Rayo Vallecano vs. Getafe. Topics:
